questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Cambodia, known for its stunning temple complex, was once the capital of the Khmer Empire?
questions.context: Built in the early 12th century, this site is famous for its intricate bas-reliefs and is the world's largest religious monument.

questions.question: This iconic modern architectural marvel in Dubai, completed in 2010, held the title of the tallest structure and building in the world.

answer.label: Burj Khalifa, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

questions.context: The building is a centerpiece in the Dubai skyline and is renowned for its striking design resembling a desert flower.

questions.question: Which historical battle site located in Belgium was the scene of Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This battle marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars and saw the coalition forces led by the Duke of Wellington and Gebhard Leberecht von Bl√ºcher defeat the French army.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Paris is the home to Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, this museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument.

questions.question: Identified as an ancient ruin and one of the New7Wonders of the World, this location in Peru is a symbol of the Incan Empire.
questions.context: Situated high in the Andes Mountains, this 15th-century Incan citadel is renowned for its sophisticated dry-stone construction.
